summary: Hawaii is a unique U.S. state made up of 137 volcanic islands in the Pacific Ocean. It is the only state not connected to the North American mainland and has a tropical climate. The islands were settled by Polynesians and later became a unified kingdom before being overthrown and annexed by the U.S. in the late 19th century. Hawaii's diverse culture blends Polynesian, Asian, and North American influences. Its economy relies on tourism, military presence, and agriculture. The state is known for its beautiful beaches, active volcanoes, and the attack on Pearl Harbor, which brought it global attention during World War II.
title: Hawaii
